description.raw:
For some reason, gazebo has historically interpreted the joint axis `<xyz>` value in the parent model frame. It would make more sense to use the child link frame, since the joint pose element for specifying the anchor location is interpreted relative to the child link frame. This is sdformat issue #43 and [gazebo issue 494](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/494).

This pull request adds a tag called `use_parent_model_frame` to the joint axis element. If true, it implies the legacy behavior (parent model frame) should be used. If false, then the child link frame should be used. This requires a bump to sdf 1.5, in order to use the Converter to provide legacy support. The converter will add the use_parent_model_frame tag with value true whenever converting version 1.4 models. For 1.5 models, the default value is false, so if the tag is omitted, the child link frame will be used.

I had to add a new `Converter::Add` function, so I added tests for it (and split the other Converter tests up a bit). I also added an `INTEGRATION_joint_axis_frame` test to verify that sdf 1.4 models would receive a value of true for `use_parent_model_frame` and sdf 1.5 models would receive a value of false.
